alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 11:51PM EDT until July 31 at 6:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The North Fork of the Kentucky River at Jackson, affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and a new flood of record is forecast. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the North Fork of the Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.1 feet, flooding will exceed the highest flood on record. Large sections of the town are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 43.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 43.5 feet overnight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.1 feet on 02/04/1939. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued 5 AM.
